meanings.definition: To carry out (a task) clumsily or incompetently.
meanings.sent1: He kept bungling the instructions and making mistakes.
meanings.sent2: She always ends up bungling simple tasks due to her lack of focus.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, his bungling attempts at cooking always end in disaster.
meanings.sent4: Her bungling of the project was like watching a comedy of errors unfold.
meanings.sent5: The image of him bungling through the dance routine is forever etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: Clumsy or incompetent in carrying out a task.
meanings.sent1: The bungling repairman only made the leak worse.
meanings.sent2: She avoided asking the bungling waiter for more water.
meanings.sent3: His bungling efforts to fix the broken toy only resulted in more pieces falling off.
meanings.sent4: The bungling detective stumbled through the case, missing crucial clues.
meanings.sent5: The bungling magician's tricks were more likely to cause laughter than amazement.
